description: Vocabulary to describe an Exif format picture data. All Exif 2.2 tags are defined as RDF properties, as well as several terms to help this schema.
label: Exif data description vocabulary

_unknown.description: An Exif tag whose meaning is not known
_unknown.label: Unknown tag

apertureValue.description: The lens aperture. The unit is the APEX value.
apertureValue.label: ApertureValue

pictTaking.description: An attribute relating to Picture-Taking Conditions
pictTaking.label: PictTaking

exifAttribute.description: A property that connects an IFD to one of its entries. Super property which integrates all Exif tags.
exifAttribute.label: Exif Attribute

bitsPerSample.description: The number of bits per image component. In this standard each component of the image is 8 bits, so the value for this tag is 8. See also SamplesPerPixel. In JPEG compressed data a JPEG marker is used instead of this tag.
bitsPerSample.label: BitsPerSample

imageDataStruct.description: An attribute relating to image data structure
imageDataStruct.label: Image Data Structure

resolution.description: a rational number representing a resolution. Could be a subProperty of other general schema.
resolution.label: Resolution

brightnessValue.description: The value of brightness. The unit is the APEX value. Ordinarily it is given in the range of -99.99 to 99.99. Note that if the numerator of the recorded value is FFFFFFFF.H, Unknown shall be indicated.
brightnessValue.label: BrightnessValue

cfaPattern.description: CCDに付いているColor filter array(CFA)のパターン。例えば普通のRGBフィルターだと、CFAPatternのデータは 02 02 00 01 01 02
cfaPattern.label: CFAPattern

colorSpace.description: The color space information tag (ColorSpace) is always recorded as the color space specifier. Normally sRGB (=1) is used to define the color space based on the PC monitor conditions and environment.
colorSpace.label: ColorSpace

imageDataCharacter.description: An attribute relating to image data characteristics
imageDataCharacter.label: Image Data Character

componentsConfiguration.description: Information specific to compressed data. The channels of each component are arranged in order from the 1st component to the 4th. For uncompressed data the data arrangement is given in the PhotometricInterpretation tag. However, since PhotometricInterpretation can only express the order of Y,Cb and Cr, this tag is provided for cases when compressed data uses components other than Y, Cb, and Cr and to enable support of other sequences.
componentsConfiguration.label: ComponentsConfiguration

imageConfig.description: An attribute relating to Image Configuration
imageConfig.label: Image Config

compressedBitsPerPixel.description: Information specific to compressed data. The compression mode used for a compressed image is indicated in unit bits per pixel.
compressedBitsPerPixel.label: CompressedBitsPerPixel

compression.description: The compression scheme used for the image data. When a primary image is JPEG compressed, this designation is not necessary and is omitted. When thumbnails use JPEG compression, this tag value is set to 6.
compression.label: Compression

contrast.description: The direction of contrast processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.
contrast.label: Contrast

copyright.description: Copyright information. In this standard the tag is used to indicate both the photographer and editor copyrights. It is the copyright notice of the person or organization claiming rights to the image.
copyright.label: Copyright

customRendered.description: The use of special processing on image data, such as rendering geared to output. When special processing is performed, the reader is expected to disable or minimize any further processing.
customRendered.label: CustomRendered

datatype.description: The Exif field data type, such as ascii, byte, short etc.
datatype.label: Data Type

date.description: a date information. Usually saved as YYYY:MM:DD (HH:MM:SS) format in Exif data, but represented here as W3C-DTF format
date.label: Date

dateAndOrTime.description: An attribute relating to Date and/or Time
dateAndOrTime.label: Date and/or Time

dateTime.description: The date and time of image creation. In this standard it is the date and time the file was changed.
dateTime.label: DateTime

dateTimeDigitized.description: The date and time when the image was stored as digital data. If, for example, an image was captured by DSC and at the same time the file was recorded, then the DateTimeOriginal and DateTimeDigitized will have the same contents.
dateTimeDigitized.label: DateTimeDigitized

dateTimeOriginal.description: The date and time when the original image data was generated. For a DSC the date and time the picture was taken are recorded.
dateTimeOriginal.label: DateTimeOriginal

deviceSettingDescription.description: Information on the picture-taking conditions of a particular camera model. The tag is used only to indicate the picture-taking conditions in the reader.
deviceSettingDescription.label: DeviceSettingDescription

digitalZoomRatio.description: The digital zoom ratio when the image was shot. If the numerator of the recorded value is 0, this indicates that digital zoom was not used.
digitalZoomRatio.label: DigitalZoomRatio

exif_IFD_Pointer.description: A pointer to the Exif IFD, which is a set of tags for recording Exif-specific attribute information.
exif_IFD_Pointer.label: Exif IFD Pointer

ifdPointer.description: A tag that refers a child IFD
ifdPointer.label: IFD Pointer

exposureBiasValue.description: The exposure bias. The unit is the APEX value. Ordinarily it is given in the range of -99.99 to 99.99.
exposureBiasValue.label: ExposureBiasValue

exposureIndex.description: CCD感度。データ形式が符号なし分数である事を除き、ISOSpeedRatingsと同じ
exposureIndex.label: ExposureIndex

exposureMode.description: the exposure mode set when the image was shot. In auto-bracketing mode, the camera shoots a series of frames of the same scene at different exposure settings.
exposureMode.label: ExposureMode

exposureProgram.description: The class of the program used by the camera to set exposure when the picture is taken.
exposureProgram.label: ExposureProgram

seconds.description: a mesurement of time length with unit of second
seconds.label: Seconds

fileSource.description: The image source. If a DSC recorded the image, this tag value of this tag always be set to 3, indicating that the image was recorded on a DSC.
fileSource.label: FileSource

flash.description: The status of flash when the image was shot.
flash.label: Flash

flashEnergy.description: BCPSによるストロボの強度
flashEnergy.label: FlashEnergy

flashpixVersion.description: The Flashpix format version supported by a FPXR file. If the FPXR function supports Flashpix format Ver. 1.0, this is indicated similarly to ExifVersion by recording "0100" as 4-byte ASCII.
flashpixVersion.label: FlashpixVersion

focalLength.description: The actual focal length of the lens, in mm. Conversion is not made to the focal length of a 35 mm film camera.
focalLength.label: FocalLength

mm.description: A length with unit of mm
mm.label: Milimeter

length.description: Length of an object. Could be a subProperty of other general schema.
length.label: Length

focalPlaneXResolution.description: The number of pixels in the image width (X) direction per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit on the camera focal plane.
focalPlaneXResolution.label: FocalPlaneXResolution

focalPlaneYResolution.description: The number of pixels in the image height (Y) direction per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit on the camera focal plane.
focalPlaneYResolution.label: FocalPlaneYResolution

gainControl.description: The degree of overall image gain adjustment.
gainControl.label: GainControl

geo.description: Geometric data such as latitude, longitude and altitude. Usually saved as rational number.
geo.label: Geometric data

gpsAltitude.description: The altitude based on the reference in GPSAltitudeRef. Altitude is expressed as one RATIONAL value. The reference unit is meters.
gpsAltitude.label: GPSAltitude

gpsInfo.description: An attribute relating to GPS information
gpsInfo.label: GPS Info

gpsAltitudeRef.description: Indicates the altitude used as the reference altitude. If the reference is sea level and the altitude is above sea level, 0 is given. If the altitude is below sea level, a value of 1 is given and the altitude is indicated as an absolute value in the GPSAltitude tag. The reference unit is meters.
gpsAltitudeRef.label: GPSAltitudeRef

gpsAreaInformation.description: A character string recording the name of the GPS area. The first byte indicates the character code used, and this is followed by the name of the GPS area.
gpsAreaInformation.label: GPSAreaInformation

gpsDOP.description: The GPS DOP (data degree of precision). An HDOP value is written during two-dimensional measurement, and PDOP during three-dimensional measurement.
gpsDOP.label: GPSDOP

gpsDateStamp.description: date and time information relative to UTC (Coordinated Universal Time). The record format is "YYYY:MM:DD" while converted to W3C-DTF to use in RDF
gpsDateStamp.label: GPSDateStamp

gpsDestBearing.description: The bearing to the destination point. The range of values is from 0.00 to 359.99.
gpsDestBearing.label: GPSDestBearing

gpsDestBearingRef.description: Indicates the reference used for giving the bearing to the destination point. 'T' denotes true direction and 'M' is magnetic direction.
gpsDestBearingRef.label: GPSDestBearingRef

gpsDestDistance.description: The distance to the destination point.
gpsDestDistance.label: GPSDestDistance

gpsDestDistanceRef.description: Indicates the unit used to express the distance to the destination point. 'K', 'M' and 'N' represent kilometers, miles and knots.
gpsDestDistanceRef.label: GPSDestDistanceRef

gpsDestLatitude.description: Latitude of destination, expressed as three values giving the degrees, minutes, and seconds, respectively.
gpsDestLatitude.label: GPSDestLatitude

gpsDestLongitude.description: Longitude of destination, expressed as three values giving the degrees, minutes, and seconds, respectively.
gpsDestLongitude.label: GPSDestLongitude

gpsDifferential.description: Indicates whether differential correction is applied to the GPS receiver.
gpsDifferential.label: GPSDifferential

gpsImgDirection.description: The direction of the image when it was captured. The range of values is from 0.00 to 359.99.
gpsImgDirection.label: GPSImgDirection

gpsImgDirectionRef.description: The reference for giving the direction of the image when it is captured. 'T' denotes true direction and 'M' is magnetic direction.
gpsImgDirectionRef.label: GPSImgDirectionRef

gpsInfo_IFD_Pointer.description: A pointer to the GPS IFD, which is a set of tags for recording GPS information.
gpsInfo_IFD_Pointer.label: GPSInfo IFD Pointer

gpsLatitude.description: The latitude, expressed as three values giving the degrees, minutes, and seconds, respectively.
gpsLatitude.label: GPSLatitude

gpsLatitudeRef.description: Indicates whether the latitude is north or south latitude. The ASCII value 'N' indicates north latitude, and 'S' is south latitude.
gpsLatitudeRef.label: GPSLatitudeRef

gpsLongitude.description: The longitude, expressed as three values giving the degrees, minutes, and seconds, respectively.
gpsLongitude.label: GPSLongitude

gpsLongitudeRef.description: Indicates whether the longitude is east or west longitude. ASCII 'E' indicates east longitude, and 'W' is west longitude.
gpsLongitudeRef.label: GPSLongitudeRef

gpsMapDatum.description: The geodetic survey data used by the GPS receiver. If the survey data is restricted to Japan, the value of this tag is 'TOKYO' or 'WGS-84'. If a GPS Info tag is recorded, it is strongly recommended that this tag be recorded.
gpsMapDatum.label: GPSMapDatum

gpsMeasureMode.description: The GPS measurement mode. '2' means two-dimensional measurement and '3' means three-dimensional measurement is in progress.
gpsMeasureMode.label: GPSMeasureMode

gpsProcessingMethod.description: A character string recording the name of the method used for location finding. The first byte indicates the character code used, and this is followed by the name of the method.
gpsProcessingMethod.label: GPSProcessingMethod

gpsSatellites.description: The GPS satellites used for measurements. This tag can be used to describe the number of satellites, their ID number, angle of elevation, azimuth, SNR and other information in ASCII notation. The format is not specified. If the GPS receiver is incapable of taking measurements, value of the tag shall be set to NULL.
gpsSatellites.label: GPSSatellites

gpsSpeed.description: The speed of GPS receiver movement.
gpsSpeed.label: GPSSpeed

gpsSpeedRef.description: The unit used to express the GPS receiver speed of movement. 'K' 'M' and 'N' represents kilometers per hour, miles per hour, and knots.
gpsSpeedRef.label: GPSSpeedRef

gpsStatus.description: The status of the GPS receiver when the image is recorded. 'A' means measurement is in progress, and 'V' means the measurement is Interoperability.
gpsStatus.label: GPSStatus

gpsTimeStamp.description: The time as UTC (Coordinated Universal Time). TimeStamp is expressed as three RATIONAL values giving the hour, minute, and second.
gpsTimeStamp.label: GPSTimeStamp

gpsTrack.description: The direction of GPS receiver movement. The range of values is from 0.00 to 359.99.
gpsTrack.label: GPSTrack

gpsTrackRef.description: The reference for giving the direction of GPS receiver movement. 'T' denotes true direction and 'M' is magnetic direction.
gpsTrackRef.label: GPSTrackRef

gpsVersionID.description: The version of GPSInfoIFD. The version is given as 2.2.0.0. This tag is mandatory when GPSInfo tag is present.
gpsVersionID.label: GPSVersionID

imageDescription.description: A character string giving the title of the image. It may be a comment such as "1988 company picnic" or the like. Two-byte character codes cannot be used. When a 2-byte code is necessary, the Exif Private tag UserComment is to be used.
imageDescription.label: ImageDescription

imageLength.description: Image height. The number of rows of image data. In JPEG compressed data a JPEG marker is used.
imageLength.label: ImageLength

imageUniqueID.description: An identifier assigned uniquely to each image. It is recorded as an ASCII string equivalent to hexadecimal notation and 128-bit fixed length.
imageUniqueID.label: ImageUniqueID

imageWidth.description: Image width. The number of columns of image data, equal to the number of pixels per row. In JPEG compressed data a JPEG marker is used instead of this tag.
imageWidth.label: ImageWidth

interopInfo.description: An attribute relating to Interoperability. Tags stored in Interoperability IFD may be defined dependently to each Interoperability rule.
interopInfo.label: Interoperability Info

interoperabilityIndex.description: Indicates the identification of the Interoperability rule. 'R98' = conforming to R98 file specification of Recommended Exif Interoperability Rules (ExifR98) or to DCF basic file stipulated by Design Rule for Camera File System. 'THM' = conforming to DCF thumbnail file stipulated by Design rule for Camera File System.
interoperabilityIndex.label: InteroperabilityIndex

interoperability_IFD_Pointer.description: A pointer to the Interoperability IFD, which is composed of tags storing the information to ensure the Interoperability
interoperability_IFD_Pointer.label: Interoperability IFD Pointer

isoSpeedRatings.description: CCD感度の銀塩フィルム換算値
isoSpeedRatings.label: ISOSpeedRatings

jpegInterchangeFormat.description: The offset to the start byte (SOI) of JPEG compressed thumbnail data. This is not used for primary image JPEG data.
jpegInterchangeFormat.label: JPEGInterchangeFormat

recOffset.description: An attribute relating to recording offset
recOffset.label: Recording Offset

jpegInterchangeFormatLength.description: The number of bytes of JPEG compressed thumbnail data. This is not used for primary image JPEG data.
jpegInterchangeFormatLength.label: JPEGInterchangeFormatLength

lightSource.description: Light source such as Daylight, Tungsten, Flash etc.
lightSource.label: LightSource

userInfo.description: An attribute relating to User Information
userInfo.label: User Info

maxApertureValue.description: The smallest F number of the lens. The unit is the APEX value. Ordinarily it is given in the range of 00.00 to 99.99, but it is not limited to this range.
maxApertureValue.label: MaxApertureValue

meter.description: A length with unit of meter
meter.label: Meter

meteringMode.description: Metering mode, such as CenterWeightedAverage, Spot, MultiSpot,Pattern, Partial etc.
meteringMode.label: MeteringMode

oecf.description: Indicates the Opto-Electric Conversion Function (OECF) specified in ISO 14524. OECF is the relationship between the camera optical input and the image values.
oecf.label: OECF

orientation.description: The image orientation viewed in terms of rows and columns.
orientation.label: Orientation

photometricInterpretation.description: Pixel composition. In JPEG compressed data a JPEG marker is used instead of this tag.
photometricInterpretation.label: PhotometricInterpretation

pimBrightness.description: Brightness info for print image matching
pimBrightness.label: PrintIM Brightness

pimInfo.description: An attribute relating to print image matching
pimInfo.label: PIM Info

pimColorBalance.description: ColorBalance info for print image matching
pimColorBalance.label: PrintIM ColorBalance

pimContrast.description: Contrast info for print image matching
pimContrast.label: PrintIM Contrast

pimSaturation.description: Saturation info for print image matching
pimSaturation.label: PrintIM Saturation

pimSharpness.description: Sharpness info for print image matching
pimSharpness.label: PrintIM Sharpness

pixelXDimension.description: Information specific to compressed data. When a compressed file is recorded, the valid width of the meaningful image shall be recorded in this tag, whether or not there is padding data or a restart marker. This tag should not exist in an uncompressed file.
pixelXDimension.label: PixelXDimension

pixelYDimension.description: Information specific to compressed data. When a compressed file is recorded, the valid height of the meaningful image shall be recorded in this tag, whether or not there is padding data or a restart marker. This tag should not exist in an uncompressed file. Since data padding is unnecessary in the vertical direction, the number of lines recorded in this valid image height tag will in fact be the same as that recorded in the SOF.
pixelYDimension.label: PixelYDimension

planarConfiguration.description: Indicates whether pixel components are recorded in chunky or planar format. In JPEG compressed files a JPEG marker is used instead of this tag. If this field does not exist, the TIFF default of 1 (chunky) is assumed.
planarConfiguration.label: PlanarConfiguration

primaryChromaticities.description: The chromaticity of the three primary colors of the image. Normally this tag is not necessary, since color space is specified in the color space information tag (ColorSpace).
primaryChromaticities.label: PrimaryChromaticities

printImageMatching_IFD_Pointer.description: A pointer to the print image matching IFD
printImageMatching_IFD_Pointer.label: PrintImageMatching IFD Pointer

referenceBlackWhite.description: The reference black point value and reference white point value. The color space is declared in a color space information tag, with the default being the value that gives the optimal image characteristics Interoperability these conditions.
referenceBlackWhite.label: ReferenceBlackWhite

relatedFile.description: Tag Relating to Related File Information
relatedFile.label: Related File

resolutionUnit.description: The unit for measuring XResolution and YResolution. The same unit is used for both XResolution and YResolution. If the image resolution in unknown, 2 (inches) is designated.
resolutionUnit.label: ResolutionUnit

rowsPerStrip.description: The number of rows per strip. This is the number of rows in the image of one strip when an image is divided into strips. With JPEG compressed data this designation is not needed and is omitted.
rowsPerStrip.label: RowsPerStrip

samplesPerPixel.description: The number of components per pixel. Since this standard applies to RGB and YCbCr images, the value set for this tag is 3. In JPEG compressed data a JPEG marker is used instead of this tag.
samplesPerPixel.label: SamplesPerPixel

saturation.description: The direction of saturation processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.
saturation.label: Saturation

sceneCaptureType.description: The type of scene that was shot. It can also be used to record the mode in which the image was shot, such as Landscape, Portrait etc. Note that this differs from the scene type (SceneType) tag.
sceneCaptureType.label: SceneCaptureType

sceneType.description: The type of scene. If a DSC recorded the image, this tag value shall always be set to 1, indicating that the image was directly photographed.
sceneType.label: SceneType

sensingMethod.description: The image sensor type on the camera or input device, such as One-chip color area sensor etc.
sensingMethod.label: SensingMethod

sharpness.description: The direction of sharpness processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.
sharpness.label: Sharpness

shutterSpeedValue.description: Shutter speed. The unit is the APEX (Additive System of Photographic Exposure) setting
shutterSpeedValue.label: ShutterSpeedValue

software.description: The name and version of the software or firmware of the camera or image input device used to generate the image.
software.label: Software

spatialFrequencyResponse.description: This tag records the camera or input device spatial frequency table and SFR values in the direction of image width, image height, and diagonal direction, as specified in ISO 12233.
spatialFrequencyResponse.label: SpatialFrequencyResponse

spectralSensitivity.description: Indicates the spectral sensitivity of each channel of the camera used. The tag value is an ASCII string compatible with the standard developed by the ASTM Technical committee.
spectralSensitivity.label: SpectralSensitivity

stripByteCounts.description: The total number of bytes in each strip. With JPEG compressed data this designation is not needed and is omitted.
stripByteCounts.label: StripByteCounts

stripOffsets.description: For each strip, the byte offset of that strip. With JPEG compressed data this designation is not needed and is omitted.
stripOffsets.label: StripOffsets

subjectArea.description: The location and area of the main subject in the overall scene.
subjectArea.label: SubjectArea

subjectDistance.description: The distance to the subject, given in meters. Note that if the numerator of the recorded value is FFFFFFFF.H, Infinity shall be indicated; and if the numerator is 0, Distance unknown shall be indicated.
subjectDistance.label: SubjectDistance

subjectDistanceRange.description: The distance to the subject, such as Macro, Close View or Distant View.
subjectDistanceRange.label: SubjectDistanceRange

subjectLocation.description: The location of the main subject in the scene. The value of this tag represents the pixel at the center of the main subject relative to the left edge, prior to rotation processing as per the Rotation tag. The first value indicates the X column number and second indicates the Y row number.
subjectLocation.label: SubjectLocation

subseconds.description: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for a date property
subseconds.label: Subseconds

tagid.description: The Exif tag number with context prefix, such as IFD type or maker name
tagid.label: Tag ID

transferFunction.description: A transfer function for the image, described in tabular style. Normally this tag is not necessary, since color space is specified in the color space information tag (ColorSpace).
transferFunction.label: TransferFunction

userComment.description: A tag for Exif users to write keywords or comments on the image besides those in ImageDescription, and without the character code limitations of the ImageDescription tag. The character code used in the UserComment tag is identified based on an ID code in a fixed 8-byte area at the start of the tag data area.
userComment.label: UserComment

whiteBalance.description: The white balance mode set when the image was shot.
whiteBalance.label: WhiteBalance

whitePoint.description: The chromaticity of the white point of the image. Normally this tag is not necessary, since color space is specified in the color space information tag (ColorSpace).
whitePoint.label: WhitePoint

xResolution.description: The number of pixels per ResolutionUnit in the ImageWidth direction. When the image resolution is unknown, 72 [dpi] is designated.
xResolution.label: XResolution

yCbCrCoefficients.description: RGB形式からYCbCr形式に変換するための3つの係数。通常は0.299、0.587、0.114という値
yCbCrCoefficients.label: YCbCrCoefficients

yCbCrPositioning.description: The position of chrominance components in relation to the luminance component. This field is designated only for JPEG compressed data or uncompressed YCbCr data.
yCbCrPositioning.label: YCbCrPositioning

yCbCrSubSampling.description: The sampling ratio of chrominance components in relation to the luminance component. In JPEG compressed data a JPEG marker is used instead of this tag.
yCbCrSubSampling.label: YCbCrSubSampling

yResolution.description: The number of pixels per ResolutionUnit in the ImageLength direction. The same value as XResolution is designated.
yResolution.label: YResolution
